title: docs: add a keyword to help find an option

'tab index' doesn't find this due to the '_' characters, so I've added a phrase without them

will hopefully help avoid isues like this https://github.com/wez/wezterm/issues/1442

title: wezterm-font: update Fira Code to v6.2, Noto Color Emoji to v2.034 (Unicode 14.0)

- updates bundled `NotoColorEmoji.ttf` to v2.034 (support for Unicode 14.0) (https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/releases/tag/v2.034)

body: AltDrag is old (latest release in 2015) and unusable with WezTerm (too much lag), AltSnap is the maintained fork that works with only a little hiccup

title: DECSTR should reset DECLRMM
body:
While the description at DEC STD-070 04-31 does not mention Left Right
Margin Mode (it does mention the left and right margins), the code at
04-34 sets it to FIXED (the reset state, the set state is SETABLE).

From esctest:
DECSETTests.test_DECSET_DECLRMM_ModeResetByDECSTR

title: Update Clink hyperlink to newer version
body: This is a newer and very actively maintained official fork (also used by Cmder now) of Clink.

title: fix: do not propagate $APPIMAGE and $APPDIR env vars to child processes
body: Some apps use `$APPIMAGE` and `$APPDIR` environment variables to figure out if they are running as an AppImage. When apps (which are not appimages) were launched from Wezterm AppImage, it tried to get resources from Wezterm's mount (since they tried to get the path relative to the $APPDIR`)

title: Fix DECRPTUI response
body:
DECRPTUI, the response to DA3, should be:
 DCS ! | D...D ST
not
 CSI = D...D ST


Can be tested with:
 - vttest (https://invisible-island.net/vttest/vttest.html) 6. Test of terminal reports → 6. Tertiary Device Attributes (DA)
 - the esctest fork at https://invent.kde.org/ninjalj/esctest, tests DA3Tests.test_DA3_0 and DA3Tests.test_DA3_NoParameter originally by Christian Persch.

title: Manjaro requires additional base-devel package
body:
When running `cargo build --release` on a fresh install of Manjaro 21.1.6, I got the following message:

```sh
   Compiling libc v0.2.107
   Compiling proc-macro2 v1.0.32
   Compiling unicode-xid v0.2.2
   Compiling autocfg v1.0.1
   Compiling cfg-if v1.0.0
   Compiling syn v1.0.81
   Compiling version_check v0.9.3
error: linker `cc` not found
  |
  = note: No such file or directory (os error 2)

error: could not compile `libc` due to previous error
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
```

I installed `base-devel` afterwards and was able to continue.

title: Unzoom when switching panes
body:
Add the `unzoom_on_switch_pane` config flag, which determines whether switching panes with `ActivatePaneDirection` while the active pane is zoomed in should first unzoom and then switch (similar to tmux' behavior), or keep the pane zoomed and do nothing.

I set it to true by default, it may be desirable to keep it false to keep current behavior.

title: tmux-cc: fix suspicious-looking decimal literals
pty: add `CommandBuilder::env_clear`, `CommandBuilder::env_remove` functions
body: Closes #1274.

title: wayland: Support disabled key repeat
body: Noticed by running in bare KWin (windowed mode, no other plasma stuff installed) and getting the "attempt to divide by zero" panic.

title: Add an FAQ entry documenting `wezterm`'s use font shaping/ligatures #1264
body:
In https://github.com/wez/wezterm/issues/1264, I had an issue related to ligatures and being unable to disable them in `wezterm`.

This PR adds a simple entry to the FAQ documenting this, hopefully in a way that makes it easy to find!

Signed-off-by: Andrew V. Jones <andrew.jones@vector.com>

title: fonts: use FcFontMatch to resolve fontconfig aliases like 'monospace' (fixes #1249)
body:
This patch adds some very careful support for `get_best_match` (`FcFontMatch`) resolution with `config_substitute` on, i.e. allows users to rely on custom aliases set in `fonts.conf`.

Here's how `wezterm.font("monospace")` looks like with various values of `monospace` in fontconfig: 

<details>
<summary>JetBrains Mono</summary>


```
Primary font:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})


When Intensity=Half Italic=true:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-ExtraLightItalic.ttf, FontConfig
  {family="JetBrains Mono", weight="ExtraLight", italic=true},

  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})


When Intensity=Half Italic=false:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-ExtraLight.ttf, FontConfig
  {family="JetBrains Mono", weight="ExtraLight"},

  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})


When Intensity=Bold Italic=false:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Bold.ttf, FontConfig
  {family="JetBrains Mono", weight="Bold"},

  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})


When Intensity=Bold Italic=true:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-BoldItalic.ttf, FontConfig
  {family="JetBrains Mono", weight="Bold", italic=true},

  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})


When Intensity=Normal Italic=true:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Italic.ttf, FontConfig
  {family="JetBrains Mono", italic=true},

  -- /usr/local/share/fonts/jetbrains-mono/JetBrainsMono-Regular.ttf, FontConfig
  "JetBrains Mono",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  -- Assumed to have Emoji Presentation
  -- Pixel sizes: [128]
  "Noto Color Emoji",

  -- <built-in>, BuiltIn
  "Last Resort High-Efficiency",

})
```

</details>

<details>
<summary>Source Code Pro</summary>

```
Primary font:
wezterm.font_with_fallback({
```

title: Some Wayland fixes and improvements
body: See the commit messages.

title: Typo fix: "boudaries" -> "boundaries"
Fix copypasta error: "slow"->"rapid".
body:
Verified behavior via:

    curl https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wez/wezterm/aca13c6977a4a7d26e2afdaab1a1a2c5f2ae4c7d/test-data/styles.txt

title: Typo fix: "overriden" -> "overridden"
ci: Simplify and clean up generate-workflows.py
body:
## Summary

A bunch of whitespace and indentation fixes and cleanups in the generated GitHub Actions workflow files.

## Why?

I noticed trailing spaces and other irregularities while working on #1159. I couldn't help but figure out and fix what was causing it. ;)

## How to review

Most of the files are generated automatically. The only file that was updated manually (and needs to be reviewed) is `ci/generate-workflows.py` with 97 line changes.

There should be no functional/behavioral changes in CI before and after this PR.

Quick note regarding

```
    strategy:
      fail-fast: false
```

Since none of the jobs use a [matrix strategy](https://docs.github.com/en/actions/learn-github-actions/workflow-syntax-for-github-actions#jobsjob_idstrategymatrix) (instead, individual workflows are used here), these lines have no effect and can be removed.

title: Remove unused Error import
body:
Hello, I noticed while installing WezTerm that there was a warning about an unused import.
I have removed this Error import in TermWiz.
I ran `cargo check` and `cargo test --all` with no errors.

title: Extend wezterm-ssh with Sftp functionality
body:
Work-in-progress to extend wezterm-ssh with sftp functionality that I need for distant-ssh2.

At the moment, this does the following:

1. Extends `SessionRequest` with additional requests for each type of sftp action that can be taken by using a new `Sftp` type
2. Adds a `File` struct that implements `smol::io::{AsyncRead, AsyncWrite}`, communicating back to the session thread to perform the actions on `ssh2::File` instances
3. Exposes a variety of dependency types that are directly used in public APIs to avoid consumers from needing to manually import those dependencies themselves
    - `filedescriptor::FileDescriptor`, 
    - `portable_pty::Child`
    - `ssh2::{FileStat, OpenFlags, OpenType, RenameFlags}`

This currently is not fully tested or working as there are a lot of async hangups that I need to debug. It may also be worth porting over some of the testing logic I've been implementing with sshd programmatically to use with this crate to maintain our sanity with it working as expected e2e.

1. The design is a ~~flat exposure of `ssh2::Sftp` methods instead of returning an sftp channel directly, or some wrapper around the sftp channel~~ to use an `Sftp` struct that contains a `SessionSender` with methods geared directly towards sending sftp requests. 
    - **I switched to this approach** :: We could alternatively switch to returning an Sftp wrapper object (holding a `SessionSender`) with the methods exposed on it that just performs the sends, and that may be cleaner than having them all directly on the session. @wez, thoughts? We could have `SessionRequest` contain just an `Sftp(Sftp)` variant where the Sftp value is another enum containing the submessage, if we want to not have everything be entirely flat.
    - Right now, we allocate a singular sftp channel upon first receiving an sftp-related message. I think this makes sense, but I don't know if there are any drawbacks. @wez?
2. The design I've seen from the existing `SessionRequest` handlers is to include a `Sender<...>` to act as a reply for the async request. These don't handle sending back error information, so I don't know if that is done elsewhere. 
    - My only thought behind these not causing async to hang indefinitely is that the sender gets dropped at the end of the request regardless, but this doesn't communicate any specific error information to the async caller, does it?
3. The file read/write I'm just calling directly in a blocking fashion. To be honest, your file descriptor and polling work was a little more than I wanted to read through last night, but I'm also not sure how much it applies and/or would work with `ssh2::File` from the sftp channel. @wez?

title: Do not run upload action on forks
body:
A small update to the "continuous" GitHub Actions workflow files.

It adds a conditional to the `Upload to Nightly Release` step in order to prevent it from running on forks.

Right now, these workflows will fail in all forked repositories (e.g. https://github.com/friederbluemle/wezterm/runs/3658906316), as the required secrets are missing (and, of course, there is no point in releasing from forks anyway).

title: window: rewind the xdg keymap fd on Wayland (fixes #1144)
body:
The wl_keyboard definition does not define that the incoming fd is always at seek position 0.
In fact, the spec says the fd "can be memory-mapped" and that's it.
And e.g. [smithay client-toolkit uses mmap](https://github.com/Smithay/client-toolkit/blob/eab2864dfebd41aab952182ff12935209ad20fdb/src/seat/keyboard/state.rs#L363), but we don't :/

[Recent](https://github.com/swaywm/wlroots/commit/d290b13871fa18dcad6cd90d9ee93e7205742124) wlroots can sometimes start returning fds that are seeked to the end.
~~Add a `rewind()` call~~ Use `pread()` (via Rust's `read_exact_at()`) to not depend on the compositor rewinding the fd.

title: lua: Add `wezterm.action_callback` to help define key callbacks
body:
Following up on https://matrix.to/#/!PirwUBcuIlTXwNveYz:matrix.org/$ets1eEk2ixZ3MgxHLrrpOoo2Rg3VI6Cg4z82IYxsOqA?via=matrix.org

I couldn't find a way to get the filename/linenumber of the call to use it for the event name without trying to use unsafe code.
It's actually not that bad, because as error in the callback will show a traceback with correct filename/linenumber.

:upside_down_face:

title: docs: Ensure Ctrl-Shift-Space binding is readable
body:
Necessary, because with the default dark background, the space is invisible:
![invisible-space](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9730330/133510773-835b411d-7f7d-44b2-9fe6-80c89b3a5ebf.png)

title: Add additional tab activation key assignments
body:
Thank you for creating the most awesome terminal emulator! :+1:

This small PR adds a few more default keybindings.

All of them are de facto standards on Linux and/or Windows.

### Cycle tabs

- Activate next tab with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>PageDown</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Tab</kbd>
- Activate previous tab with <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>PageUp</kbd> and <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>Tab</kbd>

### Directly select a tab

Using <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>NUMBER</kbd> (e.g. <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>1</kbd> for first tab, <kbd>Alt</kbd> + <kbd>2</kbd> for second tab, etc).

Example programs: Firefox, Google Chrome, VS Code, Atom, various file managers (Thunar, PCManFM), etc

In a separate commit, it also adds `.idea/` to `.gitignore` (used by CLion and other IntelliJ-based IDEs).

title: window: implement window movement by dragging on Wayland
body: Piggybacking off of `CopyAndPaste` for the required last input serial, maybe it would make sense to store it in a more "neutral" place eventually…

title: gui: cancel mouse click streak when the cursor has moved to a different cell (fixes #910)
body:
Fast-clicking users generally expect to be able to rapidly do regular selections or otherwise cancel double/triple/quad clicks, so significant mouse movement should end the streak.

Allowing tiny pixel movements to account for touchpads is necessary.
Fortunately, the position here is already in character grid cells, which provides enough margin for this.
Other code editors like gedit also seem to do this based on the character grid.

---

@zhou13 hopefully this solves #910

title: window: unbreak bypass_mouse_reporting_modifiers on Wayland (fixes #1122)
body: Modifier state was not saved to the `modifiers` field that's read when converting mouse events, so these events always had no modifiers.

title: Accept `shift + y/n` when asking for confirmation to close panes
body: This closes #1119

title: window: fix synthesized configure event for Wayland DPI scale (fixes #1111)
get-deps: Zypper needs -l (--auto-agree-with-licenses)
body: Without this switch, zypper would automatically answer "no" to any license agreements, halting the update.

title: Document workaround for get_appearance on GNOME Wayland
body: This adds a note about how to acheive dark mode detection on GNOME Wayland systems, for future generations. Follows up on #1098

title: (macOS) respect alt key configs for ime
body:
This should partially solve #615.

Currently, the config items `send_composed_key_when_(left|right)_alt_is_pressed` are ignored when `use_ime` is true.

e.g. In wezterm.lua:

```lua
return {
    use_ime = true,
    send_composed_key_when_left_alt_is_pressed = false,
    send_composed_key_when_right_alt_is_pressed = true,
}
```

Pressing `LeftAlt + a` used to produce `å`, but now it should send `<M-a>` to the shell. The behaviour of `RightAlt` is unchanged.

title: X11: Composite isn't required anymore
body: on X11 bits_per_value() reports 11 when Composite is disabled and 8 otherwise, so let's make both acceptable, shall we?

body: Add Chocolatey as an install option for Windows.

title: no close-on-exec for stdio file descriptors
body:
redirect_stdio_impl incorrectly marks new file descriptor as close-on-exec.
This is because of the dup2/dup3 calls buried down there.  
Changing this to call cloexec() only when needed seems difficult to get right for all paths through, so instead, just unmark the file descriptor as close-on-exec.
Looked for, but did not find, any test cases on this code, would like to add a test case here.

title: ci: Forgot adding Debain 11 to the docs link builder
body:
The download link wasn't getting processed in the docs for debian11. I think it's because I forgot adding this line:

 r"Debian11.deb$": "debian11_deb",

to the CATEGORIZE variable in ci/subst-release-info.py

title: Add support for setting arbitrary colors ranging from 16 to 256.
body:
Hello there, I absolutely love this terminal emulator, however for my usecase I'd need support for setting all colors in the 256 color table, do you have any interest in that? This would be useful for colorschemes like gruvbox which define a lot of colors outside the standard 4-bit color range. This pull request is my attempt to address this shortcoming. I followed the approach of [alacritty](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/blob/master/alacritty.yml#L275-L319) here which beside the `ansi` and `bright` tables allows to set arbitrary colors from 16 to 256 in an `indexed` table. This would for example make it possible to specify the whole gruvbox colorscheme like this:
```lua
local config = {
  color_scheme = "Gruvbox Dark Medium",
  color_schemes = {
    ["Gruvbox Dark Medium"] = {
      foreground = "#ebdbb2",
      background = "#282828",
      cursor_bg = "#ebdbb2",
      cursor_border = "#ebdbb2",
      cursor_fg = "#282828",
      selection_bg = "#ebdbb2",
      selection_fg = "#282828",

      ansi = {"#282828","#cc241d","#98971a","#d79921","#458588","#b16286","#689d6a","#a89984"},
      brights = {"#928374","#fb4934","#b8bb26","#fabd2f","#83a598","#d3869b","#8ec07c","#ebdbb2"},
      indexed = {
        [24]  = "#076678", [66]  = "#458588", [72]  = "#689d6a", [88]  = "#9d0006", [96]  = "#8f3f71",
        [100] = "#79740e", [106] = "#98971a", [108] = "#8ec07c", [109] = "#83a598", [124] = "#cc241d",
        [130] = "#af3a03", [132] = "#b16286", [136] = "#b57614", [142] = "#b8bb26", [166] = "#d65d0e",
        [167] = "#fb4934", [172] = "#d79921", [175] = "#d3869b", [208] = "#fe8019", [214] = "#fabd2f",
        [223] = "#ebdbb2", [228] = "#f2e5bc", [229] = "#fbf1c7", [230] = "#f9f5d7", [234] = "#1d2021",
        [235] = "#282828", [236] = "#32302f", [237] = "#3c3836", [239] = "#504945", [241] = "#665c54",
        [243] = "#7c6f64", [244] = "#928374", [245] = "#928374", [246] = "#a89984", [248] = "#bdae93",
        [250] = "#d5c4a1"
      }
    }
  }
}
```
This pull request would fix #841.

this PR updates the bundled Noto Color Emoji to [v2.028](https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/releases/tag/v2.028), from [v2.020](https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/releases/tag/v2020-09-16-unicode13_1) ([diff](https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/compare/aac7cca...c05b4b4)).

it primarily represents a [design update by Google](https://blog.google/products/android/emoji-day-redesign-easier-sharing/).

title: Added watch_path
body:
Added a watch_path global variable and function `add_to_config_reload_watch_list` which takes a variadic list of paths to append to the global watch_list

and then inside `lib.rs` checks variable and watches those specific files.
Also added a flake.nix, which was required for me to be able to develop on this, it can't build the project but you can cargo build and then you need to run the nixosGLPatch, which kinda works, but it's good enough

title: tmux-cc: parse client-detached
tmux-cc: add support for layout-change
Absolute working directory paths for CreateProcessW()
body: As mentioned in #900, CreateProcessW() expects a full path and behaves weirdly if the shell / parent process switched drives before with a relative path.

title: implement DA3 tertiary deviceattr
body: Add the third device attributes (DA3) query+reply, eliminating "unknown/unspecified CSI" error. Like XTerm, simply reply with zeroes as opposed to site codes or unique IDs. https://vt100.net/docs/vt510-rm/DA3.html

title: Remove hardcoded logic for titlebar color
body: Initial work for #894

title: Allow styling of the whole new tab button
body:
Replace `new_tab_left`, `new_tab_right`, `new_tab_hover_left` and `new_tab_hover_right` elements in `tab_bar_style` with more flexible `new_tab` and `new_tab_hover` elements.
Also introduce `new_tab` and `new_tab_hover` elements in `colors.tab_bar`.

title: docs/term: add information to make it work with WSL
body: Only problem is that it breaks Tab and Backspace for me.

title: glyph: Make heavy lines in custom glyphs heavier
body:
I think with 3.0 it is perfect for normal or bigger font sizes.
For smaller font size, it seems the stroke width is not adapted at all to the font size, is that intentional? Can we do something about it? (detect when the ratio is too big?)

See the difference:

<details>
<summary>BEFORE</summary>

### BEFORE
![heavy_not_visible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9730330/124367165-2c63c900-dc55-11eb-93c6-502752242f0c.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>AFTER</summary>

### AFTER
![heavy_visible](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9730330/124367172-32f24080-dc55-11eb-8bf1-63894bf318f4.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>AFTER (smaller font size)</summary>

### AFTER (smaller font size)
![heavy_visible_small_font_size](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9730330/124367427-61711b00-dc57-11eb-9091-1cbe4ca28beb.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>AFTER (big font size)</summary>

### AFTER (big font size)
![heavy_visible_big_font_size](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9730330/124367619-1d7f1580-dc59-11eb-9404-cfb23f879049.png)


</details>

---
The test file regroups every custom glyphs we currently have that mention `LIGHT` or `HEAVY` in their description, grouped by shapes

title: glyph: Comment the actual char for easy visualization
body: It helps visualize the char of the glyph when reading the code :smiley:

title: docs: Add note on issues with binding mouse Up event only
body:
As explained in the added note, there is an issue with binding only the Up event of a mouse binding, where the Down event is sent to the running program, but not the Up event, making weird unexpected behaviors when using such Up bindings.

This is something that had bothered me for a few months, and that I finally fixed _properly_ a few weeks ago in https://github.com/bew/dotfiles/commit/eccb7b507282, by disabling the Down event.

I think that blindly suggesting to bind something to the mouse Up event without disabling the Down event is 'dangerous', and the user reading the doc should be aware of this, so he can add a Down-disabling binding and avoid the unexpected behaviors.

title: Remove duplicate colorscheme file
body:
Looks like this accidentally slipped in. It's not in the [upstream repo](https://github.com/mbadolato/iTerm2-Color-Schemes/tree/master/wezterm) either.

* Paraiso¹ Dark :heavy_check_mark: 
* Parasio Dark :x: 

¹ Portuguese for _paradise_.

Btw, do you accept new color schemes to be added?

title: [terminfo] add smxx/rmxx, purge blink
body:
Testing with WezTerm nightly indicates no blink support
available through the xterm \E[5m, and I didn't see any
support in the code -- purge it. smxx and rmxx, meanwhile,
have been added to indicate support for struck text.

title: [sextants] fix copy-and-paste error on U+1FB06
body: As noted in https://github.com/dankamongmen/notcurses/issues/1715, there was a bad glyph definition among your sextants. This fixes it up.

title: Update wording in README.md
body: Minor wording updates to improve consistency and flow.

title: Fix spawning new tabs/windows in directory with urlunsafe paths
body: The CWD is internally stored as URL. The path component is therefore stored percent_encoded. It must be decoded before use.

body:
Please note that I know Lua but not Wezterm. I'm including this in the hope that it's useful but it's possible that it is not the correct fix.

Closes #772

body: Just a couple of minor typo fixes in `window_decorations.md`.

body: See https://github.com/rust-lang/libz-sys/pull/78 for more context.

title: Updates Noto Color Emoji to Unicode 13.1 support
body:
Greetings!

I was so glad to discover this terminal emulator. Seriously cool. Thanks for maintaining! Thought I would chip in on a low-hanging fruit that I noticed. Some newer emojis don't properly display, so I checked on the font files.

`otfinfo` output of `wezterm`'s current Noto Color Emoji font:
```shell
❯ otfinfo --info assets/fonts/NotoColorEmoji.ttf                                                                                                                                 

Family:              Noto Color Emoji
Subfamily:           Regular
Full name:           Noto Color Emoji
PostScript name:     NotoColorEmoji
Version:             Version 2.002;GOOG;noto-emoji:20170827:fe2ced85011f
Unique ID:           Noto Color Emoji
Description:         Color emoji font using CBDT glyph data.
Designer:            Google, Inc.
Designer URL:        http://www.google.com/get/noto/
Manufacturer:        Google, Inc.
Vendor URL:          http://www.google.com/get/noto/
Trademark:           Noto is a trademark of Google Inc.
Copyright:           Copyright 2013 Google Inc.
License URL:         http://scripts.sil.org/OFL
License Description: This Font Software is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1. This Font Software is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the SIL Open Font License for the specific language, permissions and limitations governing your use of this Font Software.
Vendor ID:           GOOG
```

`otfinfo` output of the [latest release](https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/releases/tag/v2020-09-16-unicode13_1) font:
```shell
❯ otfinfo --info ~/Library/Fonts/NotoColorEmoji.ttf

Family:              Noto Color Emoji
Subfamily:           Regular
Full name:           Noto Color Emoji
PostScript name:     NotoColorEmoji
Version:             Version 2.020;GOOG;noto-emoji:20200914:BETA
Unique ID:           Noto Color Emoji
Description:         Color emoji font using CBDT glyph data.
Designer:            Google, Inc.
Designer URL:        http://www.google.com/get/noto/
Manufacturer:        Google, Inc.
Vendor URL:          http://www.google.com/get/noto/
Trademark:           Noto is a trademark of Google Inc.
Copyright:           Copyright 2013 Google Inc.
License URL:         http://scripts.sil.org/OFL
License Description: This Font Software is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1. This Font Software is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the SIL Open Font License for the specific language, permissions and limitations governing your use of this Font Software.
Vendor ID:           GOOG
```

Here is a comparison of the repo between the specified commits: https://github.com/googlefonts/noto-emoji/compare/fe2ced8...aac7cca

This pull request updates the font to the latest release above, which enables Unicode 13.1 support!

Please let me know if I need add anything else.

title: Better function for undercurl
body:
This improves the rendering of the undercurl.

Before:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11978847/116011975-06ec8a80-a628-11eb-8b49-fcde12a00b87.png)

After:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11978847/116011981-0c49d500-a628-11eb-925b-98fe379af122.png)

All that is changed is the wave generation function.

What I noticed is, that the antialiasing is broken, therefor I removed
the second pixel draw, as that made the curl twice as thick as the
other lines.

title: conditionally include process divination for quit-confirm check on an…
body:
…y win/linux/osx instead of all

I've always gotten the "Really kill this window...?" confirmation even with nothing open, and on looking in the docs and finding `skip_close_confirmation_for_processes_named` nothing I tried worked. I think it's just using the wrong predicate in `divine_process_list`; this behaves as expected on Linux.

title: Remove workarounds for const expressions
body: This makes `TRANSITIONS` easier to read.

title: termwiz: do not use terminfo for unsupported 256-colors
body:
I noticed edenscm log -p (using streampager) cannot render 256 colors
if TERM is not "*-256color", despite forcing enabling true colors in
streampager (https://github.com/markbt/streampager/pull/28).

I tracked it down here. The problem is that we ask terminfo for colors
it does not claim to support. Fix it by using fallback CSI rendering
for colors exceeding the terminfo max color.

title: Support unicode charaters in `selection_word_boundary`
body:
I want to support https://unicodelookup.com/#%E2%94%82/1 (this is used as the tmux pane separator)
This is marginally slower, and it only supports "Unicode Scalar Value"s (rust char) and not graphemes, but it should be a start!

title: Create get_dimensions.md
body:
Missing document.

Was not sure how to populate "Since" from the git hash. Here is the commit: https://github.com/wez/wezterm/commit/ba5d50ba9e7c1c9ff03f7f4c0c7f7562f08e7134

title: docs: add info on installing via MacPorts
docs/hyperlinks: fix invalid escape sequence
move sudo into script to not use sudo for rust checking
body:
Rust is typically installed per user rather than globally and hence when sudo is used typically either the executable is not found or a wrong version is used instead.

Update the docs

Test:
Ran `./get-deps` and verified rust version check passed and the package manager was executed with sudo privilige

title: Add ActivateLastTab command
body:
This replicates `last-window` in tmux. To pull this off, I
deliberately store the last tab whenever I'm activating a new one or
spawning a new one. I had to do this explicitly rather than hooking
set_active, because we end up setting the active tab briefly for some
common operations like moving a tab.

title: Capture middle mouse events on macos
body:
I noticed that no matter what I did, even trying multiple mouses, I couldn't get middle-mouse-paste to work on my macos version of wezterm

Looking through the code, I found it was missing bindings to `otherMouse*` events. I added them, and lo and behold, it worked!

One question: I dont really understand the difference between the press type in `MouseEventKind` and the `buttons` in `MouseEvent`.
This code causes the middle mouse click to happen when I click ANY of the non left/right buttons on my mouse. I am not sure if thats what we want (until/if we add button bindings would change this), or if not, how I should structure the code to avoid that. I suppose we'd have to compare the decoded mouse_buttons with the MouseEventKind in `mouse_common`?

title: Fix Mulitplexing typo in book sidebar
update k9 to 0.11.0 to make it work with rustc@1.51.0
body: 1.51.0 no longer takes non string literals in `panic()`. k9@0.11.0 fixes that

title: build(deps): bump windows from 0.4.0 to 0.5.0

labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

Sourced from windows's changelog.

0.5.0

  • Support for Win32 arrays. (#608)
  • Updated metadata providing many fixes and improvements to Win32 APIs.
  • Many more improvements and fixes.
Commits

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

title: docs: fix typo
body: Liking `wezterm` so far :thumbsup:

title: openSUSE support (tested on Tumbleweed 20210317)
Use cnorm for CursorVisibility::Visible
body:
The `CursorVisible` capability corresponds to `cvvis`, which doesn't work in tmux, but also isn't the right thing to use.  We should be using `cnorm` instead.

See https://github.com/markbt/streampager/issues/37.

title: windows: Add option to treat left ctrl-alt as altgr
body:
The previous behavior was to always treat ctrl-alt as altgr on Windows,
this has been done to better support altgr through a VNC session,
but this is very unintuitive when you don't need this behavior.

Closes #472

title: wayland: do not create OpenGL context before the configure event
body:
The existing code seems to use "configure" for just resizes, so introduce a "start" flag in pending events to handle the initial configure.

---

Sort of fixes #476, not the fontconfig issue from there that I can't reproduce though

title: Fix typo
body: "will will" -> "you will"

title: Add Ctrl-u in search mode to clear the current search pattern
body:
This is a small addition to the search mode (until keys for this mode are configurable :eyes:).

Ctrl-u is a common key in shells, vim, readline to clear the input buffer, and I use it often.

title: Add some missing option doc
body:
- automatically_reload_config
- check_for_updates
- check_for_updates_interval_seconds
- show_update_window
- allow_square_glyphs_to_overflow_width
- scroll_to_bottom_on_input
- selection_word_boundary

Part of #461

title: Remove unnecessary Result in config
body: I saw this while doing #459

title: Add cli option --config-file
body:
It works! :tada: 

I didn't find a documentation for global flags/options, is it currently missing?

I'm not fond of the duplication between wezterm/wezterm-gui/wezterm-mux-server.. But this is a larger problem I think, it shouldn't be solved in this PR.

For the implementation
- I extracted the existing config load logic to a function that takes a Path, and make it used when the flag is given.

- I changed the signature of `reload` (to avoid having `reload()` and `reload_from_path(path)` functions), to take a `ConfigFileSelection` (not sure about the naming), to choose between searching the config file or using a given one.

title: doc: Update ClearScrollback default value
body: Since latest release, but it seems it wasn't updated here
